title: tls support improvements, added trust to hostname and ca certificate
body:
This PR replaces tokio-native-tls with tokio::rusttls.

This was due because with tokio-native-tls certificate authentication wasn't working properly.

Comparing to previous release it also supports now certificate authentication and it adds an example

title: add close connections
body: Fixes #180

title: Add some test
body: bump the dependencies

title: add tests for producer
body:
This PR adds more tests for the producer when:

- try to use the same id
- try to close twice 
- try to use it after close 
- test the deduplication with send batch 


There is a commented test:
```
producer_deduplication_send_after_close_error
```

because it does not work like the producer I will check it and open another PR

title: Test error conditions
body:
Add more tests for error conditions.

Fixes https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-rust-client/issues/176

title: Fix annotation get
body:
Add the implementation for get function.
Add tests for complex messages

title: bump to 0.2.0
body: We can release the 0.2.0 with le last issues fixed

title: feat(tests): adds test with invalid virtual host
body: This PR adds a test and fix the invalid virtual host case

title: Add more tests for the Environment
body:
-  `environment_create_streams_with_parameters` create stream with parameter
- `environment_fail_tls_connection` fail to connect in a non-TLS server

About TLS, we could consider to setup a server with TLS in the CI. but it is out of scope for this PR

title: Restore Coverage
body: This PR restores the coverage reporting to codecov with `cargo llvm-cov`

title: fix(tests): fixes tests on environment with wrong credentials
Initial environment tests
body:
Initial environment tests.

[These tests](https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-rust-client/pull/167/files#diff-4e4fbf534f002a8f89469d459a0b91f4282f913e3d20b49cae62ab52a53cf661R34-R59) are commented since the test goes in timeout if the `user_name` or `password` is wrong. 

Maybe there is some problem [here](https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-rust-client/blob/main/src/client/mod.rs#L443)  when there is an error.

I'd like to validate this PR before go ahead with other tests

title: Implements Heartbeat
body:
This PR implements the heartbeat handling. 

It finishes the work started here 
https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-rust-client/pull/141 it sill not handle reconnection when the server is not reachable for x period. 

Implements #95 and fixes #162

title: Fixes consumer not consuming #160
body:
This PR fixes https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-stream-rust-client/issues/160

The consumer handler was registered in the client after subscribing request and it could lead to missing some messages

title: tls_first_implementation
body:
This first implementation of TLS support includes:

- Integrate the tokio-native-tls library
- Implements an Environment Helper Class "TlsConfiguration" to manage Tls options in Environment
- Implements Tls trusting all hostnames and certificates at the moment (just encryption offered)
- Adding a test on port 5551

title: chore(CI): fix CI on PRs
body: Closes #151

title: Update clap requirement from 3.0.0-rc.5 to 4.0.22

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [clap](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from clap's releases.

v4.0.22

[4.0.22] - 2022-11-07

Fixes

  • (help) Don't overflow into next-line-help early due to stale (pre-v4) padding calculations
Changelog

Sourced from clap's changelog.

[4.0.22] - 2022-11-07

Fixes

  • (help) Don't overflow into next-line-help early due to stale (pre-v4) padding calculations

[4.0.21] - 2022-11-07

Features

  • (derive) long_about and long_help attributes, without a value, force using doc comment (before it wouldn't be set if there wasn't anything different than the short help)

[4.0.20] - 2022-11-07

Fixes

  • (derive) Allow defaulted value parser for '()' fields

[4.0.19] - 2022-11-04

Features

  • ColorChoice now implements ValueEnum

[4.0.18] - 2022-10-20

Fixes

  • (derive) Allow #[command(skip)] to also work with enum variants with a value

[4.0.17] - 2022-10-18

Fixes

  • Allow using Arg::last(true) with Arg::value_hint(ValueHint::CommandWithArguments)

[4.0.16] - 2022-10-18

Fixes

  • Arg::exclusive(true) should not be exclusive with the argument's own ArgGroup

[4.0.15] - 2022-10-13

Fixes

  • (error) Don't suggest -- when it doesn't help
  • (error) Be more consistent in quoting, punctuation, and indentation in errors

[4.0.14] - 2022-10-12

... (truncated)

title: Thread-safe Consumer
body:
ThreadRng is not Send - so e.g. spawning a Tokio task with the `Consumer` or a structure which it's a member of fails to compile (I've tried to model this in an integration test).

Fixed by using a `StdRng` which is thread-safe.

title: Implement some clippy pedantic recommendations.
body:
Implemented recommendations:
* combine duplicate match arms
* map.unrwap_or -> map_or
* change cloned -> copy when used with iterators
* remove redundant closures for method calls
* pass by reference when not consuming to avoid unnecessary allocations.

title: Publish to crates.io on tag.
body:
Add github action to publish to crates.io when a tag is pushed.
Resolves #121

~Currently draft because the crates token needs to be added to secrets before merging.~

title: fix: Create new thread_rng rather than using cache
body:
This code is likely to be used in asynchronous environments. The usage
of `rand::thread_rng()` means that the consumer can never be sync and
send, because it uses a RC to cache the ThreadRng. It's only a very
small overhead to create a new context every time, and this will enable
calling code to also be asynchronous.

title: Message in ConfirmStatus
body: This PR adds the message in the `ConfirmStatus`

title: Implement publish batching
body:
This PR add automatic batching on send. By default the batch size is `100` and it will cache the messages before sending them to the broker. The configuration on the producer `batch_delay`, which is by default `100ms` which is the schedule delay for the batch messages.

This PR also add two APIs on the `producer` for sending directly to the broker messages in batch, avoiding the delay mechanism.

Also the initial work for a benchmark tool has been done.
